website_summaries.verdict: One of the least expensive electromagnetic locks you can buy for adequate home security.
pros: Works on all sorts of door materials, from glass to metal to wood
Great for installing in cabinets that refuse to stay shut
Available to purchase in a greater holding force
cons: A few buyers complained that the product emitted a low humming noise

customer_reviews.title: Chicken gate.
customer_reviews.text: I used this magnet for something slightly different. I use it to hold a gate open for my chickens during the day when I let them run free range. I am using a Raspberry Pi to measure ambient light to open and close a trap door. When it closes in the evening I release the magnet to close the spring loaded gate to the outer pen. Are used a relay and a 12 V power supply for the magnet and it works great .
customer_reviews.author: KeithB

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly if you line it up right.
customer_reviews.text: Although the instructions could be translated better, this item works perfectly...although you do need to align the metal block and magnet with each other very well. If they are misaligned by even 2 mm you'll get a signficant reduction in force to where the attraction can be easily broken by hand. But this is the nature of the technology, and not a defect of this product in particular. You just need to have some patience and perhaps a few washers or spacer plates as necessary for proper alignment.
customer_reviews.author: John Garrison

customer_reviews.title: Alignment is critical
customer_reviews.text: This mag lock was purchased for use in a drop down hay dispenser. When the armature and magnet are in perfect alignment the hold down force is high. Any mis-alignment however in which the interface between the planes of the magnet face and armature greatly reduces the holding force. The magnetic consumes ~150 to 200 mA and gets warm after being activated for more than one hour. The temperature rise for prolong activation is an open question at this point but is of some concern when it is used close to combustible items such as dry hay.
customer_reviews.author: Colin M. Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: Barely legible instructions. Remarkably few parts. Is not an item you can take out of the box, install, and use. Despite what the misleading information on the ad would lead you to believe. Seeing as I’m not an electrician. Looks like I have a heavy paper weight to throw off a bridge. Also this item didn’t hAve any of the mounting equipment needed to make it work. Or the wires.... Pass on this.
customer_reviews.author: Grouch

customer_reviews.title: Strong magnets at a good price
customer_reviews.text: I saw the negative comments and almost didn't buy these door magnets. I glad I got them! They are plenty strong, compact and have a low power demand. And they were significantly less expensive than the next size up. I didn't try to measure holding strength, but its good enough for me. They come with very usable hardware and were easy to mount. I didn't use them on doors. I coupled parts together that should not be able to be separated by hand. These magnets perform the task I set for them.
customer_reviews.author: ceejay

customer_reviews.title: does not work, finally did...
customer_reviews.text: took long time frabicating what I needed and then the lock will not hold. Every once in a while it will hold, but is totally unusable... MODIFIED REVIEW I finally managed to get it to work, with not much help from the instruction. It has one troubling characteristic, it gets hot when left on. Not too hot to touch, but hot.
customer_reviews.author: Owltown

customer_reviews.title: Great holding power and easy flexible installation.
customer_reviews.text: This magnetic lock served just the purpose. It was easy to mount and wire up. The magnet portion is attached to a metal L bracket and allows the mounting screws to be attached to the back or the long side of the magnet. Had no difficulty installing, has a great holding power and was delivered on time. Will certainly purchase more of these in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Tidd

customer_reviews.title: actually holds 130lbs. tried 4 other magnets from all ...
customer_reviews.text: actually holds 130lbs. tried 4 other magnets from all over the place that didn't work. this one will get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Hinzpeter

customer_reviews.title: Secure
customer_reviews.text: I'm using these in an Airbnb to keep guests out of cabinets and drawers. They are perfect for that. You'll literally have to break the cabinet if they really get thru this. Takes some getting used to installing, but after 30 of them, I'll be a pro.
customer_reviews.author: Roninva

customer_reviews.title: works
customer_reviews.text: Make sure the wires are connected correctly. If the polarity is reversed, they won't work. Some transformers have the negative wire marked with white dashed line, some have the positive wire marked with white dashed line?
customer_reviews.author: BuilderBob

customer_reviews.title: good product for a gate
customer_reviews.text: works well, we are using it to secure a side gate and as learning experiment with my son (who is doing all the work). While 130lbs isn't massive it's enough to hold a gate shut.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Really strong magnetic in a small package
customer_reviews.text: I made for a STEM demonstration of electromagnetics. I used two to speed things up. Mostly high school and elementary school kids. They loved they could not lift. Even some dads tried and lifted the whole table it was clamped on.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck G.

customer_reviews.title: We didn't use this to hold a door closed so I can't attest to how strong it is for that purpose but it works great for our proje
customer_reviews.text: We built an automatic cat feeder that opens when the power is cut and used this to hold the box shut. When the timer turns the power off (or if there is a power outage) then the cats get their food. We didn't use this to hold a door closed so I can't attest to how strong it is for that purpose but it works great for our project!
customer_reviews.author: Will R

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Childproofing Lock
customer_reviews.text: Not the holding force I was hoping for, I think it would be perfect for childproofing or something similar. Whether or not it is 130 lbs. of force or not, I can't comment as this is the only one I have ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: FrankRPollardJr

customer_reviews.title: Decent Mag Lock
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be of decent quality, had to bump the voltage to 13v for a really good seal. If you really want to keep someone out though, go with the 600+LB rated mag lock.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. & Mrs. Hawks

customer_reviews.title: LOUD!!!!
customer_reviews.text: When installed it makes a constant LOUD hum/vibration that is unbearable!
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Works well as a door holder.
customer_reviews.text: Has only been a few days but works well. Easy install and works with a .8 amp 12 V. DC transformer I had lying around. I use it to hold open a door with a closer. If I forget to close the door, I turn a smart plug off with an app and the door closes automatically.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I couldn't be happier!
customer_reviews.text: I used this lock for a slide mounted refrigerator. Bungee cords and ratchet straps weren't keeping my fridge in place... well a 130-lb electromagnet does!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Thcerbla

customer_reviews.title: Tres bien
customer_reviews.text: Good product. It does heat up a fair amount...I regret not getting the next size up.
customer_reviews.author: C Shaw

customer_reviews.title: Worked great!
customer_reviews.text: Worked great with a color coded lock for our escape room.
customer_reviews.author: S. Cass

customer_reviews.title: Works great but make sure the sercaces are flush
customer_reviews.text: Works great but keep in mind that the surfaces must be aligned so that there is NO gaps. A little lateral misalignment is OK but the mating surfaces must be absolutely flush.
customer_reviews.author: C. Olson

customer_reviews.title: Work great when properly aligned
customer_reviews.text: This will hold strongly but you must ensure a proper alignment. My challenge was getting the magnet and pad to be level to each other so they rest fully together. Leaving a little slack in the mounting plate did the trick.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: No good.
customer_reviews.text: This thing cant hold back 10 lbs... bought it for a stash cubby "lock" my 2 year old can open it no problem... there is no way this will work for an actual door.
customer_reviews.author: The March Fam

customer_reviews.title: Small, strong magnet
customer_reviews.text: Nice size. Small is what I wanted. Perfect for a baby gate. Love it
customer_reviews.author: Hoggin

customer_reviews.title: Great Little magnet if you can get lined up exactly
customer_reviews.text: Great Little magnet if you can get lined up exactly. That is a little tuff but it's worth the effort. Put this with a key pad to open a cabinet and it works well.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Probably works well inside.
customer_reviews.text: Worked for 7 months outside and now has an open coil, has to be replaced. Difficult to mount as there are no mounting lugs.
customer_reviews.author: Jim van Oss

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These are tricky to get right the first few times, but they serve my purposes in escape rooms well.
customer_reviews.author: KL

customer_reviews.title: THEY DONT WORK
customer_reviews.text: They are trash. bought 2 for a gate opener installed like instructions said and they dont hold not even 5lbs of force. Very disapointed
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: No problems so far (knock on wood). I use a bunch of these in my escape room.
customer_reviews.author: Allison

customer_reviews.title: Works Great... Until it doesn't.
customer_reviews.text: Product worked well and was more than strong enough for the application it was used in. Unfortunately, after 3 hours of use, it stopped working altogether. It no longer locks, even when plugged directly into the wall with a 12V adapter.
customer_reviews.author: Nick M.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great magnets. I use these in my real-life escape room and they work great.
customer_reviews.author: Zack

customer_reviews.title: Bought it for the electromagnet. It is a great electromagnet
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for the electromagnet. It is a great electromagnet
customer_reviews.author: Athena Pantekoek

customer_reviews.title: Effective
customer_reviews.text: Works well to hold a lid securely closed on a custom built cabinet. The lock is constantly on and stays hot to the touch, though it does seem to be stable at the current temperature.
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product, holding ability is very impressive
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product, holding ability is very impressive. Don't believe the negative reviews, It must be installed with 100% contact between magnet and holder to work properly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: GREAT!!
customer_reviews.text: Works great and easy to install especially if you keep it simple buy a toggle and a 12 volt adapter and your set
customer_reviews.author: MaraAlwaysWyns

customer_reviews.title: worked great. All the hardware I needed came with the ...
customer_reviews.text: Just what I was looking for, worked great. All the hardware I needed came with the package. I will be buying more of theses.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J Wolfe

customer_reviews.title: AGPtec60KG magnet latch
customer_reviews.text: Works well for my intended use has plenty of holding power but you must take care to align it properly with the holding plate and be sure its square to the surface. The item comes with instructions and all the hard ware you need. The bracket is drilled to allow a couple different options on mounting the electronic magnet. It use very low current draw about 100ma so any decent 12V power source will work.This is the first time I've ever used one of these if you take your time mounting this and fitting it will hold well but if you don't align it right you will lose most of the holding power of this magnet.
customer_reviews.author: Frankm5

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Worked as advertised. I’m buying another one for a second door.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Another use for this magnetic lock
customer_reviews.text: This door lock won't be installed as it was designed, it will used in an Escape Room for my daughter. The magnet is small enough to be used behind a custom wooden picture frame that I'll be making, which will release a hidden clue from the bottom of said frame. The matting piece of steel that came with the lock won't be used either as it was a little to heavy so I'm making that part too. After testing it on some much thinner material, it works just fine and I'd buy this magnetic lock again if the need came up.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Escape room madness
customer_reviews.text: Don't paint them, and make sure you align then perfect. Building a themed escape room and our scenic artists painted them rendering them practically useless.
customer_reviews.author: Mazin Dajani

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for a demonstration unit I put together
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for a demonstration unit I put together! Holds strong enough for my purposes, but don't expect this to replace a full-size door maglock. Very small and compact, I even mounted it with double sided industrial tape (again, for demonstrations).
customer_reviews.author: raiderj

customer_reviews.title: Very weak magnet.
customer_reviews.text: Very weak. Mounted it on a door and could pull open door with little effort. Definitely not for a standard size door.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product. Does not hold 130lbs nor 5 lbs
customer_reviews.text: Terrible product. Does not hold 130lbs nor 5 lbs. I tested my power supply thinking it was not getting enough amp but it is putting out 3amp this requires 1 amp.
customer_reviews.author: chadwick

customer_reviews.title: Patience will be rewarded
customer_reviews.text: I would give this five stars except for the fact that it does have to be lined up *perfectly* to get a good hold (as others have said here). After a few adjustments, though, it's doing exactly what I need it to do. FYI, I used this power adapter, which came with a direct wiring adapter so everything was plug & play:
customer_reviews.author: Andrew DeVuyst

customer_reviews.title: Escape Room Puzzle
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm! Really excited.to use it in my escape room.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: you can easily pull the plate away from the magnet
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this magnet- hooked it up to 12VDC and it would not hold a magnetic flea never mind 130 lbs. Hardly draws any current and no wonder. It has no holding power. While turned on, you can easily pull the plate away from the magnet.
customer_reviews.author: Arnold Micarelli

customer_reviews.title: there are locking mechanisms that work just like normal door locks which are much
customer_reviews.text: don't get these. i did not think about power consumption when i bought these. these will draw high current because it needs constant current/power to function. there are locking mechanisms that work just like normal door locks which are much better
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: USELESS, Can not hold 5lbs at its best. DO NOT BUT THIS JUNK
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this item. The holding strength may be 5 lbs at best. It have it connected to a 30watt 2.5 amp power unit and it literally cant even hold the door closed under its own weight. 130 lbs is a joke, It can hardly hold the weight of the magnet up on itself. I'm bummed that this waited so much of my time. I made custom brackets for it and spent time getting wire and switches for a custom install that now is all pointless. Amazon should remove this item.
customer_reviews.author: Darren

customer_reviews.title: DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME MOVE ON!
customer_reviews.text: CRAP! CRAP! CRAP! This piece of JUNK wouldn't hold my daughters doll house door shut! Heck, it weighs more than it can hold! "130lb's" my ashtray! Heck it is size of a credit card holder! JUNK!
customer_reviews.author: tomm

product_meta.title: AGPtek 60kg 130LBs Holding Force Electric Magnetic Lock for Door Access Control System Electromagnet Fail-Safe NC Mode
feature_bullets: ✔ GET SECURED - AGPtEK magnetic door lock provides a strong sense of security with its outstanding holding force and significant features. The maglock is installed beneath the top of the door frame to make sure that the door remains closed and locked. With this electric magnetic lock, you have up to 130lbs of force protecting the door.

✔ KNOWING DETAILS - The lock size is 80Lx37.3Wx23.3H(mm); Armature plate: 74Lx32Wx11H(mm). Holding Force: 60kg(130lbs); Mode: NC (locked whilst power supply is operating); Voltage: DC12V; Current Draw: 0.11A ~0.15A.

✔ SECURITY BUILT FOR YOU - AGPtEK electric magnetic lock has safety function. It is built in voltage spike suppressor, Opening Mode: 90 degree swinging door. This door lock and its user-friendly design will have you secured and protected very soon!
✔ WIDE APPLICATIONS - AGPtEK magnetic door lock is suitable for Wooden Door, Glass Door, Metal Door, Fire Proof Door, etc.

✔ NOTE - Before purchasing, it is recommended that the customer checks with their local fire authority to see if there is any additional product they may need in order to comply with the local fire codes. And if you are not sure about any part of the instructions, please consult a qualified elecirician.
